title: Property bids to clarify KKR recipe for Arnott's deal
text:
KKR & Co should have a better idea about how exactly the year's biggest leveraged buyout funding package should look this week.

The private equity giant and its bankers are knocking funds together for its $3.2 billion Arnott's deal, and it's at the stage where the credit investors are running the numbers on the proposed business and capital structure.

While KKR has a bunch of first and second lien loans in Australian dollars and United States dollars, the other piece of the puzzle is the sale of three properties owned by Arnott's.

Real estate investors have joined credit funds in running the numbers on Arnott's financial position under KKR's buyout plan. Jessica Hromas

It is understood Arnott's has told credit investors it plans to use proceeds from the property sale and leaseback to partially fund a part of the overall transaction price.

So it looms as an important factor in the overall funding mix. KKR has CBRE and investment bank UBS running the sale and leaseback auction, offering three of Arnott's manufacturing facilities in Huntingwood (NSW), Virginia (Queensland) and Marleston (South Australia).
description: KKR should soon have a better idea about how the year's biggest leveraged buyout funding package will look.
